23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to recount?

When we were married - We were very excited and looking forward to the train. They said they were coming from Bathurst via Fielding and even different engines were needed for the journey. January 1907. Our was the last train through for three weeks.

For three weeks we had no privilege with the early years and we were happy every year for eleven years.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.? How often? How far?

Visit friends and times in Regina and Moose Jaw district by train.

We had school in the school in which we always attended, and people were always smiling and nice in the early years.

Barrie, Ontario. We stopped for much and visited their house. The doors were locked, and strangers were never checking for me.
